means.word_mean: 两个的,成对的,二重的,二倍的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English twinn 'double', from twi- 'two'; related to Old Norse tvinnr. Current verb senses date from late Middle English

entry.tran: 双胞胎之一;孪生儿之一
entry.def: If two people are twins, they have the same mother and were born on the same day.

example.ex: Sarah was looking after the twins...
example.tran: 萨拉当时正在照管那对双胞胎。

example.ex: I think there are many positive aspects to being a twin…
example.tran: 我认为身为双胞胎中的一个有很多积极方面。

entry.def: Twin is used to describe a pair of things that look the same and are close together.

example.tran: 世界上最大的双引擎飞机

entry.def: Twin is used to describe two things or ideas that are similar or connected in some way.

example.ex: ...the twin concepts of liberty and equality...
example.tran: 自由与平等这两个密切相关的概念

example.ex: Nothing was done to save these women from the twin evils of begging or the workhouse.
example.tran: 没有采取任何措施把这些妇女从乞讨或济贫院这两大相似的灾难中拯救出来。

entry.tran: 使结成友好地区;使结为特殊关系
entry.def: When a place or organization in one country is twinned with a place or organization in another country, a special relationship is formally established between them.

example.ex: Five Polish banks are to be twinned with counterparts in Western Europe...
example.tran: 5 家波兰银行将和 5 家西欧银行结为姐妹银行。

example.ex: The borough is twinned with Kasel in Germany.
example.tran: 该自治市与德国的卡瑟尔市结成了友好城市。

entry.def: Twin towns or cities are twinned with each other.

example.ex: This led Zagreb's twin town, Mainz, to donate £70,000-worth of high-quality equipment.
example.tran: 这使得萨格勒布的友好城市美因茨捐赠了价值 7 万英镑的高品质装备。

means.word_mean: 1. either of two offspring born at the same time from the same pregnancy

sentences.sentence: "The polished surface twinned his face and chest in reverse"

means.word_mean: 2. bring two objects, ideas, or people together;

sentences.sentence: "This fact is coupled to the other one"
"Matchmaker, can you match my daughter with a nice young man?"
"The student was paired with a partner for collaboration on the project"

auth_sentence.res_content: Everywhere else, though, Twin Sister confound expectations.

stems_affixes.word_buile: twi二,两+form形状+ed……的→adj.有两种形式的
twi二,两+n→adj.&n. 双胞胎[的],双[的],成对[的]

Sentence.sentence: When the twin towers fell, Americans stopped travelling.
People in our neighborhood find it hard to believe she's my twin sister.
Social learning theories also don't explain why reinforcement and modeling work for some children but not others, especially those in the same family and even identical twins.
He does not believe they are twin sisters.

sentences.en: Many people thought they were twins.
sentences.cn: 许多人以为他们是双胞胎。

means.word_mean: 两个相像[密切关联]的人[物]之一

sentences.en: There are twin holes on each side of the instrument.
sentences.cn: 这工具的两边各有一对孔眼。

jushi.english: There are twin holes on each side of the instrument.
jushi.chinese: 这工具的两边有一对孔眼。

jushi.english: Many people thought they were twins.
jushi.chinese: 许多人以为他们是双胞胎。

jushi.english: The plate was one of a pair, but I broke its twin.
jushi.chinese: 这盘子原来有一对,我打坏了一个。
